heading: cubs lose wood
subheading: nothing good ever happens to the chicago cubs, so why should 1999 be any different? on tuesday, baseball's perennial saps found out that they have lost pitcher kerry wood for the season, and possibly two seasons. wood, the 1998 national league rookie of the year, blew out his arm in an exhibition game. according to the cubs, the hard-throwing righthander damaged the ulnar collateral ligament in his right elbow after throwing just 26 pitches against the anaheim angels on sunday. although wood has yet to undergo an mri, the cubs have written him off for the '99 campaign. so has the chicago sun-times, which reported tuesday that wood will need the "tommy john" surgery, an elbow-reconstruction job.
author: wired staff
